title: Present Simple: Questions
description: Слушайте вопросы в Present Simple и выбирайте правильный смысл.

tasks.audioText: A man is at a coffee shop. He talks to his friend. Do you like green tea?

options.text: He asks if his friend enjoys green tea.
He asks if his friend wants coffee.
He asks if his friend sells green tea.
He asks if his friend grows green tea.

tasks.explanation: The question 'Do you like green tea?' asks about enjoying tea. Option 1 matches this meaning.

tasks.audioText: Two women are at the office. One looks at the schedule. Does she work on Saturdays?

options.text: She asks if the woman likes Saturdays.
She asks if the woman has a job on Saturdays.
She asks if the woman rests on Saturdays.
She asks if the woman travels on Saturdays.

tasks.explanation: 'Does she work on Saturdays?' asks whether someone has a job on that day. Option 2 says the same thing.

tasks.audioText: A teacher talks to a new student. The class starts at nine. Do you have a pen?

options.text: The teacher asks the student to buy a pen.
The teacher asks the student to find a pen.
The teacher asks if the student owns a pen.
The teacher asks the student to give a pen.

tasks.explanation: 'Do you have a pen?' asks about possession. Option 3 correctly says the teacher asks if the student owns a pen.

tasks.audioText: A boy and a girl are at the park. The boy has a ball. Does he play football every day?
tasks.transcript: Does he play football every day?

options.text: She asks if the boy watches football daily.
She asks if the boy plays football daily.
She asks if the boy teaches football daily.
She asks if the boy buys footballs daily.

tasks.explanation: 'Does he play football every day?' asks about a daily activity. Option 2 matches: playing football daily.

tasks.audioText: A woman is at the airport. She looks at the board. Do the planes leave on time?
tasks.transcript: Do the planes leave on time?

options.text: She asks if the planes arrive on time.
She asks if the planes are big.
She asks if the planes depart on time.
She asks if the planes fly fast.

tasks.explanation: 'Do the planes leave on time?' asks about departure time. Option 3 uses 'depart,' which means the same as 'leave.'

tasks.audioText: A family is at a restaurant. The waiter comes to their table. Does your son eat fish?

options.text: The waiter asks if the son likes the restaurant.
The waiter asks if the son cooks fish.
The waiter asks if the son catches fish.
The waiter asks if the son eats fish.

tasks.explanation: 'Does your son eat fish?' directly asks about eating fish. Option 4 says the same thing.

tasks.audioText: Two friends talk about a movie. It is a new film. Do you want to see it tonight?
tasks.transcript: Do you want to see it tonight?

options.text: He asks if his friend wants to watch the film tonight.
He asks if his friend made the film tonight.
He asks if his friend bought the film tonight.
He asks if his friend finished the film tonight.

tasks.explanation: 'Do you want to see it tonight?' asks about watching the movie. Option 1 says the same.

tasks.audioText: A mother talks to her daughter after school. The daughter looks tired. Does your teacher give a lot of homework?
tasks.transcript: Does your teacher give a lot of homework?

options.text: She asks if the teacher is friendly.
She asks if the teacher assigns much homework.
She asks if the teacher finishes homework fast.
She asks if the teacher does homework too.

tasks.explanation: 'Does your teacher give a lot of homework?' asks about the amount of homework. Option 2 matches perfectly.

tasks.audioText: A man visits a hospital. He talks to the nurse. Does the doctor see patients in the morning?
tasks.transcript: Does the doctor see patients in the morning?

options.text: He asks if the doctor works in the morning.
He asks if the doctor sleeps in the morning.
He asks if the doctor eats in the morning.
He asks if the doctor leaves in the morning.

tasks.explanation: 'Does the doctor see patients in the morning?' means the doctor works with patients. Option 1 says this.

tasks.audioText: A girl asks about her neighbor. The neighbor has a big garden. Does he grow vegetables?

options.text: She asks if the neighbor buys vegetables.
She asks if the neighbor cooks vegetables.
She asks if the neighbor grows vegetables.
She asks if the neighbor sells vegetables.

tasks.explanation: 'Does he grow vegetables?' asks about growing. Option 3 repeats the same idea exactly.

tasks.audioText: A customer enters a shop. She looks at the dresses. Do you have this in a small size?
tasks.transcript: Do you have this in a small size?

options.text: She asks if the shop has a cheaper dress.
She asks if the shop has a different color.
She asks if the shop has a smaller size.
She asks if the shop has more dresses.

tasks.explanation: 'Do you have this in a small size?' asks about a smaller size. Option 3 says the same.

tasks.audioText: Two coworkers are in the kitchen at work. One holds a cup. Do you drink coffee every morning?
tasks.transcript: Do you drink coffee every morning?

options.text: He asks if his coworker drinks coffee each morning.
He asks if his coworker makes coffee for everyone.
He asks if his coworker bought the coffee.
He asks if his coworker prefers tea.

tasks.explanation: 'Do you drink coffee every morning?' is about a daily habit. Option 1 matches perfectly.

tasks.audioText: A tourist is at a hotel. She talks to the receptionist. Does the hotel have a swimming pool?
tasks.transcript: Does the hotel have a swimming pool?

options.text: She asks if the hotel has a restaurant.
She asks if the hotel has a pool.
She asks if the hotel has a gym.
She asks if the hotel has free parking.

tasks.explanation: 'Does the hotel have a swimming pool?' asks about a pool. Option 2 says the same in shorter words.

tasks.audioText: A boy asks his sister about her cat. The cat sleeps a lot. Does it eat dry food?

options.text: He asks if the cat sleeps on dry food.
He asks if the cat plays with food.
He asks if the cat eats dry food.
He asks if the cat drinks a lot of water.

tasks.explanation: 'Does it eat dry food?' asks about the cat's diet. Option 3 repeats the same meaning.

tasks.audioText: A woman talks to her husband about the weekend. The weather is nice. Do we need an umbrella today?
tasks.transcript: Do we need an umbrella today?

options.text: She asks if they should bring a jacket.
She asks if they should bring an umbrella.
She asks if they should bring sunglasses.
She asks if they should stay at home.

tasks.explanation: 'Do we need an umbrella today?' asks about bringing an umbrella. Option 2 says the same.

short_description: Тренируйте понимание вопросов в Present Simple на слух.
